verses.text: I will extol thee, O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
Sing unto the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.+ 30.4 at…: or, to the memorial*

For his anger endureth but* a moment; in his favour is* life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh* in the morning.+ 30.5 his anger…: Heb. there is but a moment in his anger*+ 30.5 for a night: Heb. in the evening*+ 30.5 joy: Heb. singing*
And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
\+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and* I was troubled.+ 30.7 made…: Heb. settled strength for my mountain*
I cried to thee, O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**; and unto the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** I made supplication.
What profit is there* in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
Hear, O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, and have mercy upon me: \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, be thou my helper.
Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
To the end that my* glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.+ 30.12 my glory: that is, my tongue, or, my soul*
